com.clarionmedia.infinitum.rest
Interface AuthenticationStrategy

All Known Implementing Classes:
SharedSecretAuthentication
public interface AuthenticationStrategy

Describes how web service requests are authenticated. This should be implemented for specific web service authentication strategies. If using token or shared-secret authentication, SharedSecretAuthentication should be used.

Version:
1.0 03/21/12
Author:
Tyler Treat

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getAuthenticationKey()
          Returns the authentication key.
 java.lang.String getAuthenticationString()
          Retrieves the authentication String for this AuthenticationStrategy.
 java.lang.String getAuthenticationValue()
          Returns the authentication value.
 boolean isHeader()
          Indicates if the authentication is included in the request headers.
 void setHeader(boolean isHeader)
          Sets the value indicating if authentication is included in the request headers.
 

Method Detail

getAuthenticationString

java.lang.String getAuthenticationString()
Retrieves the authentication String for this AuthenticationStrategy. The authentication String is the value used to authenticate web service requests and is typically appended to the request URL or included as a header.

Returns:
authentication String

getAuthenticationKey

java.lang.String getAuthenticationKey()
Returns the authentication key.

Returns:
authentication key

getAuthenticationValue

java.lang.String getAuthenticationValue()
Returns the authentication value.

Returns:
authentication value

isHeader

boolean isHeader()
Indicates if the authentication is included in the request headers.

Returns:
true if authentication is included as a header, false if not

setHeader

void setHeader(boolean isHeader)
Sets the value indicating if authentication is included in the request headers.

Parameters:
isHeader - true if authentication is included as a header, false if not
